channel.title: International: Top News And Analysis
channel.description: CNBC International is the world leader for news on business, technology, China, trade, oil prices, the Middle East and markets.

item.title: Samsung second-quarter operating profit soars 1,458% as AI demand remains strong; results top estimates
item.description: Samsung Electronics posted higher-than-expected second-quarter revenue and operating profit, as demand for advanced memory chips remained strong.

item.title: Microsoft shares drop as cloud miss overshadows better-than-expected revenue and earnings
item.description: Microsoft said it was still supply-constrained for delivering artificial intelligence services to cloud clients. But executives called for cloud acceleration.

item.title: Here's everything you need to know about the Fed decision coming Wednesday
item.description: This week's Federal Reserve meeting might not have much bearing on the present but potentially it could have a lot to do with the future.

item.title: Asia markets are mixed as investors assess China business activity data, await Bank of Japan rate decision
item.description: The Bank of Japan is expected to raise its benchmark interest rate and detail its plan to trim its rate of bond buying.

item.title: AMD says data center sales more than doubled in a year
item.description: AMD shares are down about 7% year to date, despite the chipmaker being the second largest vendor of data center GPUs after Nvidia.

item.title: I’ve been to 100 countries. I didn't expect to want to return to these 5
item.description: Travel enthusiast Todd Miller identifies the five countries that he had assumed would be "one and done" places, but that left him wanting to know much more.

item.title: Here's how much athletes at the Paris Olympics earn for winning medals
item.description: Aside from a medal, a stuffed toy of the Olympics mascot and an official event poster, some medal winners are accorded additional financial rewards.

item.title: Where are China's ultra-rich parking their wealth amid a slowing economy?
item.description: The Chinese ultra-rich population is expected to swell to 144,897 by 2028 from 98,551 in 2023, where are they parking their wealth?

item.title: CNBC Daily Open: Tech retreats; Starbucks same-store sales decline for second straight quarter
item.description: The S&P 500 and the Nasdaq Composite closed lower on Tuesday as investors awaited quarterly earnings from Meta, Apple and Amazon later this week.

item.title: Microsoft tells employees it will hand out one-time cash awards of up to 25% of annual bonus
item.description: Microsoft wants to reward rank-and-file employees for helping to deliver accelerating revenue growth for the fiscal year that just ended.

item.title: Starbucks revenue misses estimates as same-store sales decline for second straight quarter
item.description: Starbucks' stock has tumbled 21% this year, fueled by concerns about weaker demand for its coffee in the U.S. and China.

item.title: 'Sports tourism' is huge. But the Summer Olympics caused travel to Paris to plummet
item.description: It's a common misconception that host cities see an explosion of travelers around the Olympic Games, says OAG's Chief Analyst John Grant.

item.title: Tencent Cloud downplays AI hype when it comes to making games
item.description: Use of ChatGPT-like generative AI in gaming is still in an exploratory phase, said Liang Chen, general manager of Tencent Cloud's internet industry department.

item.title: Disney's Marvel needed a direction. With a big box office and familiar faces, it may have one
item.description: "Deadpool & Wolverine" smashes box office records as Marvel Studios looks to right the ship after a series of theatrical missteps.

item.title: UAE set to welcome even more millionaires as wealthy individuals abandon the UK
item.description: "Push factors include the prospect of higher taxes under a new Labour government," one investor told CNBC.

item.title: Pinterest shares tumble nearly 15% on weak guidance
item.description: Pinterest shares sank when the company reported its second-quarter earnings and provided third-quarter guidance that was lower than analyst estimates.

item.title: First Solar tops second-quarter estimates but leaves forecast unchanged amid election uncertainty
item.description: First Solar maintained its sales guidance for the year of $4.4 billion to $4.6 billion.

item.title: Google parent Alphabet's partnership with AI firm Anthropic under investigation in the UK
item.description: The U.K.'s Competition and Markets Authority said that it is investigating Google parent Alphabet's partnership with artificial intelligence startup Anthropic.

item.title: Stellantis to offer broad buyouts to U.S. salaried workers, warns of possible layoffs
item.description: The automaker, which reported disappointing first-half results, said that if not enough its employees take buyouts, involuntary terminations could follow.

item.title: CrowdStrike shares plunge 9.7% to lowest level of the year on report that Delta may seek damages
item.description: CrowdStrike shares fell after CNBC reported on Monday that Delta hired an attorney to seek compensation following the July 19 global IT outage.

item.title: Russia approves law allowing use of crypto for global payments as it faces ongoing sanctions
item.description: Russian lawmakers on Tuesday approved a new that permits international payments via cryptocurrencies.

item.title: Meta agrees to $1.4 billion settlement in Texas biometric data lawsuit over Facebook images
item.description: The lawsuit by Texas against Meta involved the Facebook owner's capture and use of biometric data from photos and videos without authorization.

item.title: Older GLP-1 drug from Novo Nordisk may slow Alzheimer's disease progression by protecting the brain, study says
item.description: Liraglutide is sold under the brand names Saxenda and Victoza, and sales are declining as blockbuster GLP-1s Ozempic and Wegovy skyrocket in demand.

item.title: Bella Hadid 'shocked' at 'lack of sensitivity' in Adidas ad campaign linked to 1972 Munich Olympics
item.description: Hadid said that she was not aware of the historical events of the 1972 Munich Olympics, and that she would not have taken part in the campaign had she known.

item.title: At the year's biggest air show, Boeing and Airbus orders were muted. Supply chain worries were not
item.description: A roadmap of the next few months of production is emerging this week, with Airbus reporting quarterly results on Tuesday, followed by Boeing on Wednesday.

item.title: Air New Zealand becomes first major airline to scrap its 2030 climate goal
item.description: Air New Zealand on Tuesday dropped its 2030 climate goal, citing delivery delays of fuel-efficient aircraft and the affordability of alternative jet fuels.

item.title: Euro zone's economy grew 0.3% in second quarter, above expectations despite German contraction
item.description: The euro zone's economy grew by more than expected in the second quarter of 2024, flash figures from the European Union's statistics office showed Tuesday.

item.title: Pfizer beats earnings estimates, hikes full-year outlook as drugmaker cuts costs
item.description: The results come as Pfizer scrambles to stabilize its business and win back Wall Street’s favor following the rapid decline in demand for its Covid products.

item.title: Johnnie Walker-maker Diageo plunges 5% on full-year sales decline, but Guinness a bright spot
item.description: Shares of spirits giant Diageo tumbled on Tuesday morning, after the Johnnie Walker-maker posted its first sales decline since the start of the pandemic.

item.title: Merck shares fall 9% despite earnings beat, strong demand for top drugs like Keytruda
item.description: The drugmaker raised its full-year sales forecast to $63.4 billion to $64.4 billion on increased demand for key products, particularly oncology treatments.
